effect_type: The ID corresponding to this effect type
ai_script_goal: The AI Trigger ID to set
armour_attack_quantity: The amount to modify the ARMOR|ATTACK by
diplomacy: The diplomacy stance to set the stance to
object_list_unit_id: The unit type to DO|CHANGE THE <ACTION>
string_id: The string ID which will be used to <PURPOSE>
display_time: The number of seconds to display the instructions panel for
location_object: The target location referenced by an object
area: The area where units will be <ACTION>. [VERIFY:] When not set, units on the entire map are affected
object_group: The units with this class will be affected by this effect
object_type: The units of this type will be affected by this effect
attack_stance: The attack stance to set on the affected units
time_unit: The unit of time to use (In game seconds, in game minutes or simulated years)
food: Unused -- Legacy use for change technology/unit cost
wood: Unused -- Legacy use for change technology/unit cost
stone: Unused -- Legacy use for change technology/unit cost
gold: Unused -- Legacy use for change technology/unit cost
item_id: A copy from either unit list type/technology or tribute list
flash_object: When enabled, is used to flash the affected units when the source and target player are the same
force_research_technology: When enabled, is used to force the selected technology to be researched, regardless if the civilization has access to it or not
scroll: When enabled, is used to animate the camera transition. When disabled, the camera snaps to the new position without any animation
operation: The operator to apply to the target using the quantity
button_location: The location of the button to use. This number is given by the following formula: (row - 1) * 5 + column
ai_signal_value: The AI Signal ID to acknowledge
facet: The rotation of the created unit
player_color: The player color to use for the affected units
object_state: The state units need to be in to be affected by this effect
action_type: The type of action to perform on the affected units
resource_1: The new first resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
resource_1_quantity: The quantity of the first new resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
resource_2: The new second resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
resource_2_quantity: The quantity of the second new resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
resource_3: The new third resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
resource_3_quantity: The quantity of the third new resource cost for the chosen UNIT|TECHNOLOGY
string_id_option1: The string ID to use for the first decision option
string_id_option2: The string ID to use for the second decision option
variable2: The second variable to use for <PURPOSE>
max_units_affected: The maximum number of units affected by this effect
disable_garrison_unload_sound: When enabled, disables the sound that happens when unloading garrisoned units
hotkey: The hotkey ID to use for setting the train location
train_time: The train time used for the newly set train location
disable_sound: When enabled, disable the sound during the creation of the object
object_group2: The unit class to be affected by this effect
object_type2: The unit type to be affected by this effect
facet2: The rotation of the replaced unit
global_sound: When enabled, the sound will be played regardless of if the target is on screen (targeted sound events only)
issue_group_command: When enabled, will issue a task as a group formation task, instead of every unit individually
queue_action: When enabled, the set task will be queued
sound_name: The name of the sound to <PURPOSE>
selected_object_ids: The units to be affected by this effect. When defined, overwrites all other unit filters, like area selection, unit type, object type etc.
message_option1: The message to use for the first decision option. Ignored when the string ID is set.
message_option2: The message to use for the second decision option. Ignored when the string ID is set.
